oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RESULTS FROM THE DUTCH ECOBEACH PILOT PROJECT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Reedijk, Bas
Zelfde van 't, Ad
Pieterse, Jelle-Jan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: beach drainage
sediment
morphology
ecobeach
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Between 2007 and 2011 a trial has been carried out with the innovative vertical beach drainage system Ecobeach at the beach of Egmond aan Zee in the Netherlands. The pilot consisted of a field experiment, for which a statistical analysis of measured coastal state indicators was executed, and a scientific part, in which a possible working principle of the system was investigated. A significant increase in beach volume has been found during the test period. Vertical beach drainage could be applied in combination with foreshore nourishments on eroding coastlines.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; posters.26
